intro: Polygala ukambica, commonly known as the East African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Polygala. It typically grows in open woodland and grassland habitats, often in areas with well-drained soil. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
